properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the region that the server is to be created in.

properties.name: plan_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the plan that you want the server to subscribe to.

properties.name: os_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the operating system to be installed on the server.

properties.name: app_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the Vultr application to be installed on the server.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the Vultr snapshot that the server will restore for the initial installation.

properties.name: script_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the startup script you want added to the server.

properties.name: ssh_key_ids
properties.description: (Optional) A list of SSH key IDs to apply to the server on install (only valid for Linux/FreeBSD).

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: (Optional) Generic data store, which some provisioning tools and cloud operating systems use as a configuration file. It is generally consumed only once after an instance has been launched, but individual needs may vary.

properties.name: enable_ipv6
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the server has IPv6 networking activated.

properties.name: notify_activate
properties.description: (Optional) Whether an activation email will be sent when the server is ready.

properties.name: hostname
properties.description: (Optional) The hostname to assign to the server.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: (Optional) The tag to assign to the server.

properties.name: label
properties.description: (Optional) A label for the server.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: size_gb
properties.description: (Required) The size of the given block storage.

properties.name: region_id
properties.description: (Required) Region in which this block storage will reside in. (Currently only NJ/NY supported region_id 1)

properties.name: attached_id
properties.description: (Optional) VPS ID that you want to have this block storage attached to.

properties.name: label
properties.description: (Optional) Label that is given to your block storage.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: domain
properties.description: (Required) Name of domain.

properties.name: server_ip
properties.description: (Required) Server IP you want associated to domain.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: data
properties.description: (Required) IP Address of the server the domain is associated with.

properties.name: domain
properties.description: (Required) Name of the DNS Domain this record will belong to.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name (subdomain) for this record.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Type of record.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: (Optional) Priority of this record (only required for MX and SRV).

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: (Optional) The time to live of this record.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of the firewall group.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: firewall_group_id
properties.description: (Required) The firewall group that the firewall rule will belong to.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Required) The type of protocol for this firewall rule. Possible values (icmp, tcp, udp, gre) Note they must be lowercase

properties.name: network
properties.description: (Required) IP address that you want to define for this firewall rule.

properties.name: from_port
properties.description: (Optional) Port that you want to define for this rule.

properties.name: to_port
properties.description: (Optional) This can be used with the from port if you want to define multiple ports. Example from port 8085 to port 8090

properties.name: notes
properties.description: (Optional) A simple note for a given firewall rule
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: url
properties.description: (Required) URL pointing to the ISO file.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region_id
properties.description: (Required) The region ID that you want the network to be created in.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) The description you want to give your network.

properties.name: cidr_block
properties.description: (Optional) The IPv4 subnet and subnet mask to be used when attaching servers to this network.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region_id
properties.description: (Required) The region ID that you want the reserved IP to be created in.

properties.name: ip_type
properties.description: (Required) The type of reserved IP that you want. Either "v4" or "v6".

properties.name: label
properties.description: (Optional) The label you want to give your reserved IP.

properties.name: attached_id
properties.description: (Optional) The VPS ID you want this reserved IP to be attached to.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the region that the server is to be created in.

properties.name: plan_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the plan that you want the server to subscribe to.

properties.name: os_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the operating system to be installed on the server.

properties.name: iso_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the ISO file to be installed on the server.

properties.name: app_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the Vultr application to be installed on the server.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the Vultr snapshot that the server will restore for the initial installation.

properties.name: script_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the startup script you want added to the server.

properties.name: firewall_group_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the firewall group to assign to the server.

properties.name: network_ids
properties.description: (Optional) A list of private network IDs to be attached to the server.

properties.name: ssh_key_ids
properties.description: (Optional) A list of SSH key IDs to apply to the server on install (only valid for Linux/FreeBSD).

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: (Optional) Generic data store, which some provisioning tools and cloud operating systems use as a configuration file. It is generally consumed only once after an instance has been launched, but individual needs may vary.

properties.name: auto_backup
properties.description: (Optional) Whether automatic backups will be enabled for this server (these have an extra charge associated with them).

properties.name: enable_ipv6
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the server has IPv6 networking activated.

properties.name: enable_private_network
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the server has private networking support enabled.

properties.name: notify_activate
properties.description: (Optional) Whether an activation email will be sent when the server is ready.

properties.name: ddos_protection
properties.description: (Optional) Whether DDOS protection will be enabled on the server (there is an additional charge for this).

properties.name: hostname
properties.description: (Optional) The hostname to assign to the server.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: (Optional) The tag to assign to the server.

properties.name: label
properties.description: (Optional) A label for the server.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: url
properties.description: (Required) URL of the given resource you want to create a snapshot from.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: vps_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of a given server that you want to create a snapshot from.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) The description for the given snapshot.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name/label of the SSH key.

properties.name: ssh_key
properties.description: (Required) The public SSH key.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the given script.

properties.name: script
properties.description: (Required) Contents of the startup script.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) Type of startup script. Default is boot.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name for this user.

properties.name: email
properties.description: (Required) Email for this user.

properties.name: password
properties.description: (Required) Password for this user.

properties.name: api_enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Whether API is enabled for the user. Default behavior is set to enabled.

properties.name: acl
properties.description: (Optional) The access control list for the user.
